com.github.stefanbirkner.filtertools.filter.http.filteraction

Class FilterActionSwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.stefanbirkner.filtertools.filter.http.filteraction.FilterActionSwitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FilterAction

    public class FilterActionSwitch
extends Object
implements FilterAction
    Creates a FilterAction that executes one of two specified actions based on the outcome of a Predicate. The switch is created by an Fluent API. 
    FilterAction actionSwitch = FilterActionSwitch.execute(new DoSomething())
    .when(new APredicate())
    .otherwiseExecute(new DoSomethingElse());
    Since:
    1.3.0

      • init

        public void init(javax.servlet.FilterConfig filterConfig)
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Description copied from interface: FilterAction
        Called to indicate to an action that it is being placed into service. The init method is called exactly once The init method must complete successfully before the action executed.
        Specified by:
        init in interface FilterAction
        Parameters:
        filterConfig - A filter configuration object used by a servlet container to pass information to an action during initialization.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if an exception has occurred that interferes with the action's normal operation

      • execute

        public void execute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
             throws IOException,
                    javax.servlet.ServletException
        Description copied from interface: FilterAction
        The execute method of the action is called by a filter before or after the FilterChain is invoked depending on the filter itself.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface FilterAction
        Parameters:
        request - an HttpServletRequest
        response - an HttpServletResponse
        Throws:
        IOException - if an input or output exception occurs
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if an exception has occurred that interferes with the action's normal operation

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: FilterAction
        Called to indicate to an action that it is being taken out of service. This method is only called once. After this method is called, the execute method is not called again on this instance of the filter.

        This method gives the action an opportunity to clean up any resources that are being held (for example, memory, file handles, threads).

        Specified by:
        destroy in interface FilterAction
